answers.answer: Hello,Are you diagnosed as diabetic?  What is your glucose level and A1C level?If these are high you should be treated with oral meds / insulin, as necessary to normalise your numbers.  If you have diabetes you have much higher risk of UTI and the UTI is harder to treat as bacteria will love the sugar in your urine.THe brown could be from blood, from the irritation of the UTI.Definitely you should see your doctor and make sure the diabetes is agressively managed.

question: I have a utinary tract infection. I am currently taking Ciproflacin 500mg.  I take a pill every 12 hours.  I do not itch anymore but i still have a burn when i pee and it is a kind of a steady burn.  My glucose level is high and so is my acl1 level so i think i might be a diabetic.  I am currently having a slight itch all over my body but it is not intense.  Also i notice that when I wipe for the past 2 weeks there is brown specks of like some kind of hair or a brown like dirt  specks.  What is wrong.?  When i took the urine test there was some kind of contamination.
title: utinary tract infection
